name: ITP - ASPHALT SURFACE RENEWAL INSPECTION TESTING PLAN
template name: ITP - ASPHALT SURFACE RENEWAL INSPECTION TESTING PLAN Rev 1

name: Milling
1.01 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Surface Level, Shape, and crossfall
Reference Documents - RITS Table 3.24, NZTA M10:2020 10.1
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - String line or GPS rover
Material Test Frequency - 5 Points across full width of carriageway at 10m frequency, Edge of Seal, Centre of Lane, Centerline, Centre of Lane, Edge of Seal
Target Criteria - +10mm/-0mm from design or nominated level, No more than 8mm deviation from a 3m straight edge
Action Point Records Required - Survey record
Responsibility - QA / SE / PE
1.02 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Surface Inspection
Reference Documents - NZTA M10:2020 9.2
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - Visual Inspection
Material Test Frequency - 100% of Surface Prior to paving
Target Criteria - The surface on which the paving is to be laid shall be free from standing water, and any loose material, dust, clay or foreign matter shall be removed by sweeping.
Action Point Records Required - Hold Point
Responsibility - QA / SE / PE
AUTHORITY HOLDPOINT
1.03 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Does the surface pre-treatment meet project requirments?
Reference Documents - NZTA M27:2020 9.3, NZTA M10:2020 9.2, NZTA SP-M-032
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - Design requirements
○ Visual confirmation after milling
○ NZTA SP-M-032: Step 4  Bond and Seal
Material Test Frequency - 100% of Surface Prior to paving
Target Criteria - Is the suggested surface pre-treatment still suitable after inspectiing the milled surface?
Action Point Records Required - Hold Point
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE / ER
AUTHORITY HOLDPOINT
Surface pre-treatment, Membrane or Chipseal
Material Test Method Requirement - Seal Design
Reference Documents - NZTA M27:2020 9.3, NZTA M10:2020 9.2, NZTA SP-M-032
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - TNZ M/1 Table 1 Tests
Material Test Frequency - Prior to sealing commencing (Minimum 1 week prior to application)
Target Criteria - Meets project requirements
Action Point Records Required - Hold Point
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE / ER
AUTHORITY HOLDPOINT
Material Test Method Requirement - Has the material used in this layer been formally accepted for use?
Reference Documents - Insert Material Testing
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - See PQE
Material Test Frequency - Prior to construction commencing
Target Criteria - Material meets project requirements
Action Point Records Required - Hold Point
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE
AUTHORITY HOLDPOINT
2.03 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Preseal Inspection
Reference Documents - TNZ B/02: 2005
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - TNZ B/02: 2005
Material Test Frequency - 100% of Surface Prior to sealing of surface
Target Criteria - All loose aggregate, dirt, dust, silt and deleterious matter has been removed.
Action Point Records Required - Test Record
Responsibility - FM /QA / SE / PE
2.04 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Road temp
Reference Documents - TNZ P3:1995.18
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - Temperature recorded on site prior to sealing commencing
Material Test Frequency - Once per day of sealing prior to sealing commencing
Target Criteria - Air temp >10°C
Action Point Records Required - Spray sheet
Responsibility - QA / SE / PE
2.05 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Application Rate
Reference Documents - TNZ P/3 : 1995.18
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - Quantity of binder sprayed in any spray run measured by dipstick reading or a calibrated accumulating rev counter fiited to sprayer
Material Test Frequency - Dipstick measurements before spraying is commenced from tank and after the last spray from the tank or prior to it's refilling
Target Criteria - binder application rate is +/-50ltrs + 4% of the application rate
Action Point Records Required - Spray Sheet
Responsibility - QA / SE / PE
2.06 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Chip spread rate
Reference Documents - TNZ P3: 1995.21
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - area sealed (m2) to be divided by the volume of chip spread (m3), Chipsealing in New Zealand (pg 435)
Material Test Frequency - Total amount of chip used to be calculated at end of days sealing
Target Criteria - Visual checks meets seal design requirements
Action Point Records Required - Witness Point/Spray sheet
Responsibility - QA / SE / PE
2.07 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Post Seal Inspection
Reference Documents -  TNZ P3: 1995
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - Engineers Inspection
Material Test Frequency - After sealing
Target Criteria - The chip is embedded, uniformily placed and chipseal is fit for purpose
Action Point Records Required - Witness Point
Responsibility - QA / SE / PE
DG and AC Mixes NZTA M10:2020, SMA Mixes NZTA M27:2020, PA Mixes TNZ P/11
Material Test Method Requirement - Has the material used in this layer been formally accepted for use?
Reference Documents - Insert Asphalt Design & Material Records NZTA SP-M-032 Asphalt Surfacing Treatment selection Guidelines
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - Approved Treatment Design
Material Test Frequency - Prior to paving works commencing
Target Criteria - Treatment Design validation
Action Point Records Required - Hold Point
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE
AUTHORITY HOLDPOINT
Material Test Method Requirement - In-situ mat density calibration cores
Reference Documents - NZTA M10:2020 9.9.1, NZTA M27:2020 9.9.1
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - ASTM D5361
Material Test Frequency - One test per 900 t of asphalt plant production
Target Criteria -  Characteristic value - mix design air void +3% -2%
Action Point Records Required - Hold Point
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE
AUTHORITY HOLDPOINT
Material Test Method Requirement - Grading (Particle Size Distribution)
Reference Documents - NZTA M10: 2020 Table 5.2, NZTA M27:2020 Table 5.2, TNZ P/11:2007 Table 7.1
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) -    NZS 4407:2015 test 3.8
Material Test Frequency - One test per 900 t of asphalt plant production
Target Criteria - Tolerance from nominated JMF grading as per NZTA M10 Table 5.3, NZTA M27 Table 5.3, TNZ P/11 Table 7.1
Action Point Records Required - Test record
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE
Material Test Method Requirement - Binder content
Reference Documents - NZTA M10: 2020 Table 5.2, NZTA M27:2020 Table 5.2, TNZ P/11:2007 Table 7.1
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - ASTM D2172
Material Test Frequency - One test per 900 t of asphalt plant production
Target Criteria - Tolerance on JMF
○ Individual ±0.5 (All)
○ Rolling Average of 3  ±0.3% (DG, AC, SMA)
○ Rolling Average of 3  ±0.4% (PA)
Action Point Records Required - Test record
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE
Material Test Method Requirement - Air Voids
Reference Documents - NZTA M10: 2020 Table 5.2, NZTA M27:2020 Table 5.2, TNZ P/11:2007 Table 7.1
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - ASTM D3203-22
Material Test Frequency - One test per 900 t of asphalt plant production
Target Criteria - As specified for each mix type
Action Point Records Required - Test record
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE
Material Test Method Requirement - Maximum Theoratical Specific Gravity
Reference Documents - NZTA M10: 2020 Table 5.2, NZTA M27:2020 Table 5.2, TNZ P/11:2007 Table 7.1
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - ASTM D2041
Material Test Frequency - One test per 900 t of asphalt plant production
Target Criteria - Report Value
Action Point Records Required - Test record
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE
3.07 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Load Locate
Reference Documents - Downer Procedures
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - Each load can be indentified to a location. Record includes:
– Truck ID/Rego/Driver
– Depart Plant Time
– Arrive Site Time
– AC Temp on Arrival
– Ground Temp on Arrival
– Tonnage
– Run Width
– Estimated Run Length
– Calculated Area
– Calculated Average Depth
Material Test Frequency - Every Load
Target Criteria - All data is collected
Action Point Records Required - QA Sheet
Responsibility - QA / SE / PE
3.08 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - NDM Density Testing On-Site Mat and Joint
Reference Documents - NZTA M10:2020 9.9.1 and 9.9.2, NZTA M27:2020 9.9.1 and 9.9.2
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - ASTM D2950, ASTM D5361
Material Test Frequency - 1 test per 300m² per layer (Min 8 / Construction lot), 1 test per 100m per layer length (min 3 / Construction lot)
○ Target Criteria - Mat: Mean air voids JMF +3,-2
Join: Mean air voids JMF +5,-2
Action Point Records Required - Test record
Responsibility - QA / SE / PE
3.09 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Surface Level- Stringline checks for validation
Reference Documents - NZTA M10:2020 10.2, NZTA M27: 2020 10.2, Downer Procedures
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - NZTA M/10
Material Test Frequency - 5 Points across full width of carriageway at 10m frequency
○ Edge of Seal, Centre of Lane, Centerline, Centre of Lane, Edge of Seal
Target Criteria - +10mm/-0mm from design or nominated level
○ No more than 8mm deviation from a 3m straight edge
Action Point Records Required - Survey record
Responsibility - QA / SE / PE
3.10 - Field
Material Test Method Requirement - Post Surfacing Inspection
Reference Documents - CCA Procedures
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - Contract Specifications
Material Test Frequency - 100% of site After surfacing (within 5 days)
Target Criteria - Line marking has been reinstated
○ All excess material has been removed from site
○ All CPs are clear from filter fabric and any excess material removed from on top service covers
Action Point Records Required - Hold Point
Responsibility - QA / SE / PE
AUTHORITY HOLDPOINT
Post Construction
Material Test Method Requirement - Asbuilt and RAMM Data
Reference Documents - RAMM  Update sheet
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - Asset Management Information Plan
Material Test Frequency - After works complete
Target Criteria - RAMM sheet 100% complete and accurate .
Action Point Records Required - RAMM Asset Update sheet
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE
Material Test Method Requirement - High speed Rutting & NAASRA - Road Roughness
Reference Documents - CCA DOC
Material Acceptance Criteria (Method) - Laser Profilometer Survey
Material Test Frequency - After first coat sealing and prior to final surfacing with either EMOGPA, OGPA, SMA, or second coat sealing; After 12 months of trafficking;  End of defects liability
○ All lanes at 20m intervals in each wheel path and staggered by 10m between wheel paths
Target Criteria - High Speed Rutting: > 5mm Report to Designer
○ NAASRA reading: Shall not exceed 70 counts/km as a 95th percentile value
Action Point Records Required - Test Record
Responsibility - SE / PE / PM / PQE
